#summary Using IDataReaders

= !ExecuteReader =
{{{IDataReader ExecuteReader(IDbCommand command);}}}<br>
{{{IDataReader ExecuteReader(string commandText, params object[] paramNameValueList);}}}

The Glue !ExecuteReader methods return an open IDataReader. Use it if you have created a custom SQL query or an IDbCommand for which the resulting data is not scalar and cannot be mapped to objects using Glue.Mapping.
Readers should be closed after use. The easiest way is with a "using" statement.

{{{
// Using an IDbCommand
IDbCommand command = DataProvider.Current.CreateSelectCommand(
        "Contacts",             // table 
        "Id,DisplayName",       // columns
        null,                   // filter
        "-DisplayName,+Id",     // order
        Limit.Range(100,110)    // limit
    );
using (IDataReader reader = DataProvider.Current.ExecuteReader(command))
    while (reader.Read())
        Console.WriteLine(reader["Id"]);

// Using a custom query
using (IDataReader reader = DataProvider.Current.ExecuteReader("SELECT * FROM Contacts"))
    while (reader.Read())
        Console.WriteLine(reader[0]);

}}}
